item.title: Dumped box of gas canisters, 30th January
item.description:
Unsure if they're full or empty, but somebody has dumped what looks like a box of gas canisters over the side of the road. I put them back in the box and placed on the grass next to the road. Not sure if hazardous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Valence Road, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Black bag of rubbish in grass near wall, 30th January
item.description:
This bag has been here around as long as the rubbish in the nearby trees. I imagine it's rubbish because it's a black bag that's been sitting there.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbey Road, West Heath, Greater London

item.title: Illegal Parking Blocking Access, 30th January
item.description:
Hello, As you can see in the attached picture, people are using this area for parking, even though parking is not allowed here.Woodsford building Portland Street London The vehicles are blocking the entrance, which makes it impossible to remove the rubbish and access the area properly. Could you please send local officers to address this issue? Thank you for your assistance. Kind regards,

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Portland Street, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish by trees, 30th January
item.description:
This rubbish has been here over a week now and people are adding to it. It started with cardboard and some plastic containers, but it seems someone has taken the plastic and left the cardboard. There is also litter starting to build up. That's the problem, when one person fly tips, others use that as an opportunity to litter and leave more rubbish.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbey Road, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter , dog fouling, 30th January
item.description:
Litter can be found by the curbs on both sides of Marden Crescent. Unfortunately, someone didn't pick up after their dog yesterday. Please can you clean up the street. When planning your cleanup, please take into account that there are parked cars on both sides. Therefore, cleaning is only possible after peak hours, when most residents are driving out.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Marden Crescent, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car abandoned, 30th January
item.description:
Car has been parked on road for several weeks now and not moved. In good condition - not sure if it has been dumped or is not running? Parked away from curb. During busy times, due to how it is parked can cause limitations on parking.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Paget Rise, Plumstead

item.title: Unauthorised shed blocking access and bin storage, 30th January
item.description:
A shed has been erected in a communal area blocking access to the bin storage area and blocking access to the back garden, The shed is near my property and has not been given permission by the council or housing association. The shed is on common land
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Crusoe Mews, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
